Article Title: Mulayam Singh Yadav shadow looms as SP gears up to turn a 'Saffron tide'
Article Text:
Construction has been in full swing on a five-acre piece of land, situated in the heart of

Saifai

, the native village of

SP chief

Akhilesh Yadav, for some time now. This is where a memorial and a towering statue of Akhilesh's father and party patriarch

Mulayam Singh Yadav

, fondly known as '

Netaji

', is proposed to come up soon.

"It is a prestigious project which will be a profound tribute to Netaji whose ideas are ingrained in everyone's psyche here," asserts Vikas Shakya, a small-time shopkeeper in Saifai, the powerhouse of SP politics in this Yadav-dominated region.

The town, situated around 15 km off the Lucknow-Agra Expressway, is part of Etawah district but comes under

Mainpuri Lok Sabha constituency

. The seat is currently represented by Akhilesh's wife

Dimple

who won the seat in 2022 bypolls which were necessitated following the demise of Mulayam.

She had then defeated

's Raghuraj Singh Shakya by a record 2.88 lakh votes garnering more than 64% of the total votes polled.

Dimple is back in the fray and up against UP minister Jaiveer Singh, a Thakur. So is her husband Akhilesh who will be contesting from Kannauj against BJP's sitting MP Subrata Pathak. Two of other Akhilesh's cousins, too, are gearing up for a contest from different constituencies in the region - Aditya Yadav (Badaun) and Akshay Yadav (Firozabad).

Akhilesh's another cousin, Dharmendra Yadav, is trying his luck from east UP's Azamgarh district which, too, has a sizable population of

Yadavs

and Muslims. BSP has fielded Shiv Pratap Yadav from Mainpuri, a move that could potentially nudge the SP, unlike in 2019 when BSP had cobbled up an alliance with the Akhilesh-led outfit.

"Hum sab Netaji ka parivar hi hain...yahan cycle ke alawa kuch nahi chalta (We are from Netaji's family.

Here nothing moves other than the bicycle)," said Manik Chand Yadav who runs a small printing shop opposite a tall Hanuman statue constructed during the previous SP regime. The statue itself is a key landmark in the village, otherwise dotted with some of the key facilities, including

UP University of Medical Sciences

, a host of educational institutions and even an airstrip with the night landing facility.

Not surprisingly, for all practical reasons, Saifai has turned into SP's political headquarters for the past couple of months.

Be it Akhilesh, Dimple or their uncle Shivpal Yadav, they all essentially operate from Saifai - devising strategies and channeling the party's manpower to retain their political stronghold in the region.

Dimple has been moving from village to village reaching out to every section in Mainpuri, which goes to poll in the third phase. She is being assisted by her elder daughter Aditi who, too, is pulling all stops to ensure her mother's win.

The party has also roped in Saifai gram pradhan Ram Phal Valmiki, a Dalit, to garner SC votes in favour of the party.

"There is no denying that we are contesting in Netaji's name. He is the one who groomed the party and all of us," said SP's Mainpuri district president Alok Shakya.

The BJP, too, is going all guns blazing to turn the contest into a sharper square-off with the Congress-backed SP. While the party's campaign in Mainpuri and other SP bastions are being spearheaded by PM Modi, home minister Amit Shah, CM Yogi Adityanath and the saffron party workers carry out the aggressive ground-level spadework.

Around 40 km from Saifai, the Mainpuri assembly segment bustles with high-decibel campaign activity. A host of BJP's campaign vehicles armed with LED screens and campaign material move swiftly. "Our target is to hold at least 10 small sabhas in each assembly segment," said a BJP worker entrusted with the task of coordinating with the campaign vans. In other stretches along Mainpuri, large trucks move around playing songs highlighting the achievement of the Narendra Modi government.

Jaiveer himself has set up a camp office in Mainpuri assembly seat which he represents as an MLA. A host of high-end SUVs bearing saffron flags wait outside the office as party workers with saffron 'gamchhas' (scarves) wrapped around their necks ferry bunches of campaign material. The office is primarily coordinated by Jaiveer's son Sumit whose wife Harshita is the zila panchayat member in Firozabad.

Akhilesh, a sitting MLA from Karhal assembly seat in Mainpuri, had first won from Kannauj in 2000 in a by-election after Mulayam vacated the seat to retain Sambhal.

Kannauj, too, happened to be the bastion of SP until BJP's Subrata Pathak breached it by defeating Dimple in a close contest in 2019 LS polls. Pathak defeated Dimple by a slender margin of 12,300 votes. The town which primarily boasts of being the hub of 'itr' (perfume) is getting a whiff of a tough contest between Akhilesh and Pathak. At the stake is the prestige of Akhilesh, who banks on his popularity as the archrival of BJP.

Pathak, on the other hand, tends to rely on his image of being a 'local' leader who can "easily connect" with the electorate.

"Whatever development happened in this region was only and only because of the Samajwadi Party. No one can ignore the fact," asserts Mahendra Singh Yadav, who runs a medicine shop in the buzzing market in Kannauj Sadar. Yadav recounts a slew of projects which were shaped up during Akhilesh tenure: "Expressway, Lohia park, medical college, engineering college..

.the list can go on and on...," he said. Akhilesh is soon expected to start camping in Kannauj which goes to poll in the fourth phase on May 13.

Yadav's fellow shopkeeper, Vishnu Kumar Shukla, however, slams the previous SP dispensation accusing it of "lawlessness" and "anarchy". "People haven't forgotten the previous SP days when we were forced to close our shops early in the evening," he said.

Etawah, which happens to be a reserved constituency, within the Yadav belt, too, is witnessing a close contest between the SP and BJP, even as the BSP seeks to make its presence felt.

The constituency is a mixed of rural and urban precincts with a distinct electoral bloc comprising Yadavs, Dalits, OBCs, Brahmins and Rajputs. The BJP, as a matter of fact, has been winning the seat since 2014.
Article Summary: Saifai, the native village of SP chief Akhilesh Yadav, is the powerhouse of SP politics in this Yadav-dominated region. The town, situated around 15 km off the Lucknow-Agra Expressway, is part of Etawah district but comes under Mainpuri. The seat is currently represented by Dimple Yadav who won the seat in 2022 bypolls.

Article Title: Kanhaiya Kumar: Kanhaiya Kumar and Raaj Kumar Anand File Nominations for Lok Sabha Seats
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Congress ’s Kanhaiya Kumar and former Delhi minister Raaj Kumar Anand, who has joined BSP , on Monday filed their nominations from the Northeast Delhi and New Delhi Lok Sabha seats , respectively.Before filing his nomination, Kanhaiya participated in religious ceremonies at his election office, performing rituals from Hinduism, Sikhism, Islam and Christianity in the presence of priests from each faith.He was then accompanied by former Congress minister Narendra Nath, AAP minister Gopal Rai and Burari MLA Sanjeev Jha to submit his nomination papers to the returning officer at the Nand Nagari office.Later, Kanhaiya led an impressive roadshow in the constituency. However, his decision to file his nomination before participating in the rally caused some confusion among supporters who were waiting at the party office and dancing to the beat of drums and tunes of songs customised for him. The huge crowd brought traffic to a standstill, with police and party volunteers struggling to manage the situation.Waving flags of Congress, AAP and CPM, several supporters claimed Kanhaiya would “give sleepless night” to his opponent Manoj Tiwari, the sitting MP from BJP, who had defeated Congress’s Sheila Dikshit in 2019 by a margin of over 3.6 lakh votes.Around 12.30pm, delayed due to snarls caused by his own rally, Kanhaiya reached the party office on foot. On seeing him, his supporters lifted him on their shoulders and began the rally — ‘Nyay ka Arambh’. Over the next few hours, the mass gathering, which stretched to over a kilometre, saw several DJs, hundreds of e-rickshaw drivers and JCB machines spraying flowers and party poppers. Supporters chanted slogans like “Abhineta nahi, beta chune” (‘choose son over actor’, a reference to Tiwari) as patriotic songs played in the background.Addressing the gathering, Kanhaiya called the BJP govt “a dictatorial regime” and asserted the “Constitution was in danger”. He made several references to Lord Krishna, drawing parallels from his life: “I am Kanhaiya Kumar, and Lord Krishna (Kanhaiya) was born in a jail. You (Modi) also sent me to jail…”Questioning his opponent’s achievements, he said, “It was reported he carried out work worth Rs 14,000 crore. But, can you see it?” He also asked: “Even 280 seats are enough to resolve the issues of unemployment and poverty. Why does this govt need 400?”Meanwhile, at Jamnagar House that houses the office of the returning officer of New Delhi LS seat, Anand arrived quietly with a few supporters, without any procession or sloganeering. Later, speaking to the media, he said he was contesting the election “to make people aware the lollipops being offered by some people in Delhi were of no use to them”. “Their foundation is being weakened. People should come out of this and support their own party,” the BSP nominee said.
Article Summary: Congress’s Kanhaiya Kumar and former Delhi minister Raaj Kumar Anand, who has joined BSP, on Monday filed their nominations from the Northeast Delhi and New Delhi Lok Sabha seats. Before filing his nomination, he performed rituals from Hinduism, Sikhism, Islam and Christianity.

Article Title: Delhi doesn’t want MPs who don’t work: Rai
Article Text:
We also published the following articles recently

BJPs Sehrawat files papers, 57 in the fray in Delhi now

Kamaljeet Sehrawat and Abdul Basit filed nominations for Delhi's Lok Sabha elections. No East Delhi candidates. More BJP, Congress, AAP nominations expected. Sehrawat's convoy caused West Delhi traffic. Sankalp Patra boosts parental voting engagement.

BJPs Delhi manifesto likely to focus on central hospitals, roads

BJP's Delhi manifesto addresses various issues including healthcare, wages, education, pollution, unauthorised colonies, and sealing of local shopping centres to improve the quality of life in the capital.

Bid to finish off AAP didn't work: Kuldeep Kumar

Kuldeep Kumar, an AAP leader, promises to address law enforcement, addiction recovery, and public facility development in East Delhi, emphasizing the fight against dictatorship and defending AAP leaders' arrests.

New Delhi: AAP minister Gopal Rai on Monday held public meetings in Laxmi Nagar and Shahdara and campaigned for Kuldeep Kumar , INDIA bloc’s candidate from East Delhi LS seat.Taking a dig at BJP, Rai said, “People of Delhi had trusted Modi and gave all seven seats to BJP. This time, they don’t want MPs who haven’t worked for them in 10 years. Delhi has decided to give all seven seats to INDIA bloc.” Kumar, on the other hand, had a proven record of working in his area as a councillor and an MLA, Rai said.Addressing the Sankalp Sabha in Laxmi Nagar, Rai said the entire country is waiting for June 4.“AAP and Congress are contesting the elections together. Ever since the poll process started, BJP’s only response to issues like jobs, inflation and atrocities on farmers has been the slogan of ‘400 paar’. Even after all these years, there are no answers to people’s questions. For 10 years, the youth, farmers, labourers and women of this country have seen their voices being suppressed by this govt. Now, people across the country are raising slogans of BJP’s defeat,” he said.People present in the crowd, including Kumar, took an ‘oath’ to “teach a lesson to BJP with their votes”.Delhi BJP vice president Yogita Singh slammed AAP, saying it had lost public support and was trying to rake up frivolous issues. “Rai should tell us why AAP is aligned with Congress, which curtailed rights during Emergency,” she added.“Central govt contributed to developing Delhi by setting up new schools and hospitals, and gave the city the best highway infrastructure,” she said.
Article Summary: Kuldeep Kumar, an AAP leader, promises to address law enforcement, addiction recovery, and public facility development in East Delhi. Kumar emphasizes the fight against dictatorship and defends AAP leaders' arrests. AAP minister Gopal Rai held public meetings in Laxmi Nagar and Shahdara.

Article Title: Congress: Congress sees Udit Raj, Kanhaiya as central to plans beyond polls
Article Text:
We also published the following articles recently

Congress fields Raj Babbar from Gurgaon, changes tactic with first non-Yadav candidate

Raj Babbar chosen as Congress candidate for Gurgaon Lok Sabha seat in alliance with AAP. Departure from tradition with non-Yadav nominee. Facing BJP's Rao Inderjit Singh, Babbar's Punjabi background boosts optimism for poll prospects.

Devendra Yadav appointed interim president of Delhi Congress after Arvinder Lovely's exit

Devendra Yadav appointed interim president of Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee after Arvinder Singh Lovely resigns due to AAP coalition decision for Lok Sabha elections. Delhi Congress unit opposed alliance.

Former Delhi Congress chief Arvinder Singh Lovely joins BJP

Arvinder Singh Lovely joined BJP from Congress, citing AAP alliance. Confident in BJP forming govt, he referred to Indira Gandhi and Tukde Tukde gang. He returned to BJP after a brief stint in Congress.

New Delhi: The Congress brass has ignored the rebellion of its Delhi unit members led by the defection of Arvinder Lovely and his confidants, laying great store by its decision to tie up with AAP and pick Kanhaiya Kumar and Udit Raj for two key city constituencies.Congress believes that choice of Kumar and Raj goes beyond the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, as they are at the heart of the party’s attempt to reorient the organisation in sync with the changing demographics of the city state that once had a distinct old Punjabi flavour.Quickly recovering from the Lovely shock, Congress appointed AICC functionary Devender Yadav as the city chief, and put the organisation back on the campaign trail. Interestingly, Yadav was against the alliance with AAP while Lovely single-handedly pushed for it, but now Yadav is working to oil the alliance machine in party’s interest while the former party head has joined the BJP.Sources said North-East Delhi was a difficult constituency where a conventional party face would have found it difficult to mount a campaign against popular Bhojpuri star in sitting MP Manoj Tiwari, while a non-Bihar-UP neta would have been a non-starter. Instead, Kumar, who has a personal name recall as a student leader, has gone headlong into the campaign, which is bound to force the BJP to take the rival seriously. Also, besides the presence of voters with UP-Bihar roots, there are areas with an influential community which identify themselves with the caste of Kumar.Though BJP is a frontrunner in Delhi, Congress believes that seamless support from alliance partner’s base can result in a good fight.Congress is also happy with the feedback on Dalit activist turned politician Udit Raj, stating that his identification with his community is complete and requires no patchwork. His only weakness are the statements about certain strong non-Dalit communities that he issued in the past.Sources said betting on Kumar and Raj goes beyond the LS polls, as Congress looks at spreading its net among Hindi heartland migrants and among Dalits, which are two social groups that have become influential in the identity politics of the city.“Earlier, Delhi had a strong Punjabi influence, but now we have to quickly move to other groups, and we need faces which can be the bridges with them,” a senior Congress functionary said.
Article Summary: Former Delhi Congress chief Arvinder Singh Lovely joined BJP from Congress. He returned to BJP after a brief stint in Congress. Devendra Yadav was against the alliance with AAP while Lovely single-handedly pushed for it. Now Yadav is working to oil the alliance machine in party’s interest.

Article Title: 'Modi has failed to maintain dignity': Priyanka Gandhi Vadra
Article Text: Priyanka listed out the key poll issues and targeted PM Narendra Modi. "Look at the kind of language he uses... he has failed to maintain the dignity of his position... Sometimes I feel that had Nehru and Gandhi been alive ... they could not have imagined that the govt of the nation would keep public interest on the back burner," she said. Congress believes in the politics of service, truth, and transparency, she said.
Article Summary: Congress believes in the politics of service, truth, and transparency, she said. "Sometimes I feel that had Nehru and Gandhi been alive... they could not have imagined that the govt of the nation would keep public interest on the back burner," Priyanka said.
